contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=September 2007}} [[File:Map.Kuzuu-Town.Tochigi.PNG|thumb|Map of Kuzu, Tochigi]] {{nihongo|'''Kuzū'''|葛生町|Kuzū-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Aso District, Tochigi|Aso District]], [[Tochigi Prefecture|Tochigi]], [[Japan]]. On February 28, 2005 Kuzū, along with the town of [[Tanuma, Tochigi|Tanuma]], also from [[Aso District, Tochigi|Aso District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Sano, Tochigi|Sano]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 12,011 and a [[population density|density]] of 131.04 persons per km². The total area was 91.66 km². [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Tochigi Prefecture]] {{Tochigi-geo-stub}}
